item.title: Recipes
item.description: Getting started Put one kubernetes resource to the directory: ./nginx.yaml: apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: nginx-deployment spec: selector: matchLabels: app: nginx replicas: 2 template: metadata: labels: app: nginx spec: containers: - name: nginx image: nginx:1.7.9 ports: - containerPort: 80 Create an override file to the ./transformations/mylabels.yaml - type: Add path: - metadata - annotations value: felkszible: generated And execute the generation: ./flekszible generate -d ./out The result will be something like this:

item.title: Reference
item.description: Path Many transformations requires a Path definition to address a specific node in the yaml tree. Path is a string array where each element represents a new level. Array elements are indexed from zero (eg [“foo”,“barr”,0]) _except if the elements in the array are maps with name key. In this case the index is this name. For example: apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: nginx-deployment labels: felkszible: generated spec: selector: matchLabels: app: nginx replicas: 2 template: metadata: labels: app: nginx annotations: {} spec: containers: - name: nginx image: nginx:1.

item.title: Transformations
